intro: Hieracium expallidiceps, commonly known as the pale-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow with a pale center, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium expallidiceps is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
